verses.text: Then Solomon began to build the house of the LORD in Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the LORD had appeared to his father David, at the place that David had prepared on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.comment: Translates location with expanded clarity. 'House of the LORD' for temple.

verses.text: He began to build on the second day of the second month in the fourth year of his reign.
Now these were the foundations Solomon laid for building the house of God: The length, according to the former measure, was sixty cubits, and the width twenty cubits.
verses.comment: Uses modern phrasing while retaining cubit measurements.

verses.text: The vestibule in front was twenty cubits long, across the width of the house, and its height was one hundred and twenty cubits. He overlaid it inside with pure gold.
verses.comment: Reflects some ancient sources showing 120 cubits; note: most manuscripts have this variant.

verses.text: He paneled the main hall with cypress wood, overlaid it with fine gold, and decorated it with palm trees and chains.
verses.comment: Maintains the original setting and decoration.

verses.text: He adorned the house with precious stones for beauty, and the gold he used was gold from Parvaim.
verses.comment: Translates ‘Parvaim’; location uncertain in original Hebrew.

verses.text: He overlaid the beams, thresholds, walls, and doors of the temple with gold, and he carved cherubim on the walls.
verses.comment: Retains original order and architectural details.

verses.text: He made the Most Holy Place. Its length, across the width of the house, was twenty cubits, and its width was twenty cubits. He overlaid it with six hundred talents of fine gold.
verses.comment: Details for Holy of Holies; measurements kept literal.

verses.text: The weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold. He overlaid the upper rooms with gold.
verses.comment: Maintains the specificity about nails and upper rooms.

verses.text: He made two cherubim of sculptured work in the Most Holy Place, and overlaid them with gold.
verses.comment: Literal translation of the construction and gilding of the cherubim.

verses.text: The wings of the cherubim together were twenty cubits long. One wing of one cherub was five cubits, stretching to the wall of the house, and its other wing, five cubits, reached to the wing of the other cherub.
verses.comment: Detailed as per the original, plain measurement.

verses.text: One wing of the second cherub was five cubits, stretching to the wall of the house, and its other wing, five cubits, was joined to the wing of the first cherub.
verses.comment: Mirrors verse 11 in structure, as in original.

verses.text: The wings of these cherubim were spread out twenty cubits. They stood on their feet, facing the main hall.
verses.comment: Orientation is literal per Hebrew, facing outwards.

verses.text: He made the veil of blue, purple, and crimson yarn and fine linen, and embroidered cherubim on it.
verses.comment: Color translations reflect contemporary names; cherubim embroidered as stated.

verses.text: In front of the temple he made two pillars, thirty-five cubits high, with a capital on top of each measuring five cubits.
verses.comment: Height follows the text; some manuscripts vary on pillar measurements.

verses.text: He made chains as in the inner sanctuary and set them on top of the pillars; and he made a hundred pomegranates and put them on the chains.
He set up the pillars in front of the temple, one on the right and the other on the left; he called the one on the right Jachin, and the one on the left Boaz.
verses.comment: Names retained as in original; no changed meaning.
